2.text: No doubt but ye [are] the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

3.text: But I have understanding as well as you; I [am] not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?

4.text: I am [as] one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright [man is] laughed to scorn.

5.text: He that is ready to slip with [his] feet [is as] a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

6.text: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth [abundantly].

7.text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:

8.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.

9.text: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?

10.text: In whose hand [is] the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

11.text: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

12.text: With the ancient [is] wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

13.text: With him [is] wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.

14.text: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.

15.text: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.

16.text: With him [is] strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver [are] his.

17.text: He leadeth counsellers away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.

18.text: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.

19.text: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.

20.text: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.

21.text: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.

22.text: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.

23.text: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them [again].

24.text: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness [where there is] no way.

25.text: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like [a] drunken [man].
